paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the L539fs/47-hERG mutation in the KCNH2 gene, detailing its effects on cell apoptosis and endoplasmic reticulum stress.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cell apoptosis due to endoplasmic reticulum stress
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The L539fs/47-hERG homozygous mutant protein only exhibited a band at 60-70 kDa, which was attributed to protein truncation.

functional_data.summary: The L539fs/47-hERG mutation leads to protein retention in the endoplasmic reticulum and induces cell apoptosis.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is associated with increased apoptosis in cardiomyocytes.
key_quotes: The results demonstrate that L539fs/47-hERG induces cell apoptosis and the potential molecular mechanism involves the activation of ERS and ERS-mediated cell apoptosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the KCNH2 gene variant.
